pullRequest.body:
* Make API for `IsSquare` / `Even` consistent between the "official" definition and equivalent ones
* Add new lemma `exists_apply_eq_and_isSquare ` that's analogous to `IsSquare.map`

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

‚ö†Ô∏è The sha of the head commit of this PR conflicts with #20558. Mergify cannot evaluate rules on this PR. ‚ö†Ô∏è
‚ö†Ô∏è The sha of the head commit of this PR conflicts with #20558. Mergify cannot evaluate rules on this PR. ‚ö†Ô∏è

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20558~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

nit:
```suggestion
lemma isSquare_iff_exists_mul_self (a : Œ±) : IsSquare a ‚Üî ‚àÉ r, a = r * r := .rfl
```

So you were against writing this as 
```suggestion
lemma isSquare_subset_image_isSquare {f : F} (hf : Function.Surjective f) :
    {b | IsSquare b} ‚äÜ f '' {a | IsSquare a} := fun _ ‚ü®s, _‚ü© => by
```
? I still quite like it
Let me see if the automation around it works well enough (I know it's defeq but that's not the point)
yeah OK it's fine I'll change it thx

OK the issue is that this file does not import [Set.setOf_mem_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Basic.html#Set.setOf_mem_eq), which is the necessary lemma required for working with your version to be sensible
of course it's defeq but that's super weird behaviour
Oh, but that's such a basic lemma that you can just import it

I think this file is supposed to be *really* basic though, like look at the assert_not_exists!

I think we have the choices of:
1. Increasing the imports
2. Using the non-set statement
3. Splitting the file

4. Move `Set.setOf_mem_eq` earlier

EDIT: I was the one adding the `assert_not_exists` ü§£
You are asking to move the basic set API earlier than `Data.Set.Basic`
There's `Data.Set.Operations` which is even more basic than `Data.Set.Basic`
OK tried moving the lemmas back there
Pro-tip: Instead of introducing then casing on `hf _`, you can start the proof with `rw [hf.forall]`
oh cool! but that doesn't work if you change the lemma ;)
`rw [subset_def, hf.forall]` then :wink:
this file doesn't import that lemma (see my other comment)

> rw [subset_def, hf.forall]

this doesn't make the proof better because the casing on hf isn't affected
(just tried it)

```suggestion
  use r * r
  simp [*]
```
or (my favorite)
```suggestion
  exact ‚ü®r * r, by simp [*]‚ü©
```

```suggestion
    {b | IsSquare b} ‚äÜ f '' {a | IsSquare a} := fun b ‚ü®s, _‚ü© => by
```
Hmm, I wonder where are we using these defeq abuse lemmas.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Group/Even): Add missing lemmas
